page.title: 01LANDSCAPE OF INCE BLUNDELL
page.content: Our block lies on the coastal Lancashire plain to the north of the Mersey Estuary. It is low-lying with small woods and copses standing out against the horizon. The small River Alt disects our block diagonally from south-east to north west. The land is used for mixed farming including cereal and root crops and the rearing of beef cattle. One of the most dominant features of the landscape is the walled parkland of {Ince Blundell Hall,} formerly the home of the Weld-Blundell family. The main centres of population are the village of Ince Blundell and the tiny hamlet of Homer Green.
